column2: group_by(NAME,SEX,RACE) %>% dplyr::summarise(pop2015 = sum(POPESTIMATE2015),pop2016 = sum(POPESTIMATE2016),pop2017 = sum(POPESTIMATE2017),pop2018 = sum(POPESTIMATE2018),pop2019 = sum(POPESTIMATE2019))
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'NAME', 'SEX'. You can override using the `.groups` argument.
mapvalues(pop$RACE,from = c("1","2","3","4","5","6"), to = c("White","Black","American Indian","Asian",'Native Islander',"Two or more races"))
